meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's your old pal, back with another review that's gonna make you wanna hop on the speedrun train! Today, we're diving into the world of Neon White, a game that'll have you flying high and feeling like a total boss (or maybe not, but hey, at least it'll be fun trying!).

First off, let me just say that I'm still trying to wrap my head around how this game combines so many different elements. It's part platformer, part shooter, part visual novel, and part... well, cat-dating sim? Yeah, that's a thing (don't ask). But trust me when I say that it all comes together in a way that's just pure magic.

The art style is straight fire, with visuals that are so bright and bold you'll need shades. The music is equally impressive, with tunes that'll have you pumped up and ready to take on the demons (yes, there are demons in this game). And as for the mechanics - well, let's just say it takes some serious skill to get through those levels without dying a thousand deaths (or at least, not feeling like it).

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about the story?" Well, let me tell you, it's got heart (pun intended). It's not necessarily groundbreaking or anything, but it's cute and endearing, and hey, who doesn't love a good ol' fashioned underdog tale?

But enough about that - what really matters is how the game plays. And trust me when I say that Neon White delivers on that front. It's got just the right amount of challenge to keep you hooked without feeling overwhelming. Plus, there are leaderboards and stuff for all you competitive types out there (or, you know, if you're like me and just wanna see how fast you can get through a level).

So what do I think? Well, let's just say that Neon White is the kind of game that'll have you hooked from the start. It's got style, it's got substance, and it's got more than enough cat puns to keep me going (okay, maybe not those last two). In short, if you haven't tried this game yet - what are you waiting for? Get on it!
